  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package was found leaking and wet, it was placed in a bag in a tote and taken to QA for prompt processing. DescribePack: two of the cans had their lids slightly ajar thanks to the plastic cover rings coming loose as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was placed in a bag in a tote to contain further leaking.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed flammable liquid package was located coming from the load ends and was noticeably wet. Further inspection of package confirmed that one of the bottles inside was damaged and leaking. DescribePack: Missing cap from one of the plastic bottles inside DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Placed under hood in haz cage and stood box upright to prevent further release of liquid product.

item.title: Report E-2023080346
item.description:
Report E-2023080346

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN2794 Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid release from an 1855-pound battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of battery acid released impacting a 4' x 4' area of the concrete bay below the trailer and a 5' x 12' area of the trailer floor. The battery tipped over during dock operations, losing a cell cap. Contractors were able to upright the battery and replace the cap and re-secure it for shipment on. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The waste was then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080766
item.description:
Report E-2023080766

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1993 PenRay Winter Pow-R Plus Diesel Anti-Gel release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 7-gallons of product released to a 15’ x 8’ area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080323
item.description:
Report E-2023080323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a NA1993 Spec-Aid 8Q123ULS release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of product released impacting a 5" x 1" area of the tote lid due to being crushed/punctured as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080485
item.description:
Report E-2023080485

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 250-gallon tote of UN3266 leaked approximately ten (10) gallons of product due to a faulty valve. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES+ to remediate the impacted site. ES+ personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. Crews transferred the product from the 330-gallon tote into one (1) 250-gallon tote and two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2023070882
item.description:
Report E-2023070882

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX INTERMODAL TERMINALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/14/23 at 1912hrs personnel with CSX Intermodal East St Louis, ILL Terminal discovered APHU659439, a freight container of "Freight All Kinds" with interior explosion and fire. The Fairmont City, IL fire department responded and extinguished the fire- no injuries were reported and no waterways impacted. Upon opening of the container, it was determined the lading included a hazardous commodity that was not described on the shipper's bill-of-lading; (UN3480, Lithium-Ion Batteries, Class 9, PG II). There were no indications of a hazardous material shipment on shipper's bill-of-lading or the freight container. CSXT emergency response contractor, ENVIROSERVE, was dispatched to the scene for cleanup after scene was released by the fire dept. The response contractor decontaminated all impacted areas and separated damaged lading into one roll-off unit. All damaged freight was transported to the customer’s facility for further handling. In addition to the shipment containing an undeclared hazardous materials, the cause of the fire/explsoin was due to inadequate blocking and bracing of the lading inside the container. This allowed the lading to rub against itself, creating arc-friction, resulting in an explosion with fire. The rail shipper, CMA-CGM America LLC, representative was notified by CSXI Customer Service, Case 672321. The Illinois EMA was notified, report# H-2023-0587.

item.title: Report E-2023080336
item.description:
Report E-2023080336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 7.5-gallon pail of resin was crushed by surrounding freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HazChem personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged drum were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • Description: On July 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged drum were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. The cardboard, shrink wrap, and damaged containers were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. Crews.

item.title: Report E-2023080179
item.description:
Report E-2023080179

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: Bedford Park
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Water
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUANTIX LIQUID TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Burst hose

item.title: Report E-2023080173
item.description:
Report E-2023080173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3295 was damaged and released approximately one half (.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE contained the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE deployed absorbents and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted absorbents. All impacted absorbents, debris, and PPE were contained in the same 55-gallon drum. HCE labeled and staged the pail onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report I-2023070002
item.description:
Report I-2023070002

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AER LINGUS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment 125-59060116 was tendered to Aer Lingus in Chicago, IL on June 24,2023 from AIT Worldwide Logistics containing packages of Lithium Batteries Metal Batteries contained in equipment in compliance with Section Il of PI 970. The shipment was accepted and flown to Dublin on Aer Lingus flight EI122/24Jun. Upon arrival in Dublin, the shipment was investigated and found to have incorrect markings indicating the consignment actually contained fully regulated Lithium Batteries contained in equipment that had not been properly declared. The shipper provided an updated AWB and shippers declaration for the cargo after it had already been flown from Chicago from Dublin.
